column4: hi, does anyone running ubuntu-amd64 have problems with ugly fonts (in xmms menus and in vlc for example) ?
the fonts in those apps are ugly in any linux version
: I meant uglier ;)
you can limit the pain with "switch" though, to choose a different gtk1 theme
and font. it wont let you use ttf fonts though
however I keep hearing about multimedia problems like stuff not working or only working half in ubuntu 64bit. I hear the recommendation is to use the 32 bit version for now
: so my problems come from the fact it's the amd64 version ?
I don't know about your font problem
you can't get flash or the java plugin to work in 64 bit ubuntu either
: yes I figured out that
but it seems I'm lacking some fonts
I can't find all the codecs you need for 64bit either
maybe. I think you can use "switch" like I mentioned to choose a different font
: ok I'm gonna try it, and if not successful I'll switch to the 32bits version of ubuntu
: by the way, is that normal there's so few package updates on ubuntu64 ?
I think you be better off with the 32bit version for now. btw switch is in the pacage "gtk-theme-switch"
I think there are less, yes. however enable universe and multiverse
: it's already done
I think I'll switch back to the 32bits
thanks for your help :)
the 64bit version doesn't seem ready for desktops
